snippet: A federal judge on Wednesday described the internal inquiry that cleared Gov. Chris Christie in the George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal as a “calculated strategy” of “opacity and gamesmanship.”
abstract: Federal Judge Susan D Wigenton criticizes internal investigation of George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal that cleared New Jersey Gov Chris Christie for its lack of transparency; Wigenton faults firm Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher, which was hired by Christie to conduct investigation.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Wednesday described the internal inquiry that cleared Gov. Chris Christie in the George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal as a “calculated strategy” of “opacity and gamesmanship.”

headline.main: Judge Faults Firm’s Failure to Keep Notes in Christie Bridge Investigation
headline.print_headline: Judge Criticizes Transparency of Internal Inquiry of Christie

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
